snippet: A listing of author discussions, film screenings, cultural activities and walking tours in New York City.

byline.original: By JORDAN KLEBANOW, ANNE MANCUSO, MARTIN TSAI and LAUREL GRAEBER

snippet: A guide to theater productions in New York, with a special note of shows in previews or about to open.
Summary: Rocky start for stocks in 2014; Apple, Netflix fall; U.S. economy still improving; Martha settles with Macy's; Fiat's Chrysler deal. Bobbi Rebell reports.

headline.main: Investors lock in 2013 gains, sinking stocks

snippet: “Ping-Pong Diplomacy” builds up to the events of 1971, when an American team was unexpectedly invited to visit China to participate in a table tennis competition.
abstract: Janet Maslin reviews book Ping-Pong Diplomacy: The Secret History Behind the Game That Changed the World by Nicholas Griffin.

snippet: Alicia Keys and BlackBerry Ltd will cut ties at the end of January, just one year after the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter was hired as a "global creative director" for the struggling smartphone maker.

headline.main: BlackBerry and Singer Alicia Keys to Part Ways
headline.print_headline: BlackBerry and Singer Alicia Keys to Part Ways

snippet: In its new season, starting on Sunday, “Downton Abbey” continues to depict class divisions in a way that panders to contemporary notions of democracy and equality.
abstract: Alessandra Stanley The TV Watch column opines that Downton Abbey, PBS television show about British society, appeals strongly to Americans because its depictions of class differences invoke contemporary notions of democracy and equality.

snippet: Major stock gauges declined on Thursday on light trading, which analysts attributed to continued holiday vacations.
abstract: Stocks decline on light post-holiday trading, as declines in energy and technology shares weigh on market.

headline.main: After Robust 2013, Shares Open Year With a Decline
headline.print_headline: After Robust 2013, Shares Open Year With a Decline

snippet: U.S. stocks fell on their first day of trading in 2014 as investors booked profits in the wake of the S&P 500's best yearly advance since 1997, with many of last year's strongest performers down on the day.

headline.main: Wall Street Starts 2014 With Drop as Investors Take Profits
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Starts 2014 With Drop as Investors Take Profits

snippet: Chinese budget smartphone maker Xiaomi plans to sell 40 million handsets in 2014, more than double the number it sold in 2013, its chairman said on Thursday, reinforcing the company's ambitions to outsell more expensive offerings from Apple Inc an...

headline.main: China's Xiaomi Says to More Than Double Smartphone Sales in 2014
headline.print_headline: China's Xiaomi Says to More Than Double Smartphone Sales in 2014

snippet: Veteran technology journalists Walt Mossberg and Kara Swisher have unveiled "Re/code," a technology news site and conference business to succeed AllThingsD which they founded and built into a premier tech media brand within News Corp.

headline.main: AllThingsD Editors Launch 'Re/code' Venture With NBCUniversal Backing
headline.print_headline: AllThingsD Editors Launch 'Re/code' Venture With NBCUniversal Backing
